clinical_study.brief_title: Developing and Validating the Caring Questionnaire of Service Learning Courses
clinical_study.official_title: Developing and Validating the Caring Questionnaire of Service Learning Courses: Using the Transformative Learning Model and Theory of Planned Behavior

lead_sponsor.agency: Central Taiwan University of Science and Technology

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Science and Technology, Taiwan

clinical_study.source: Central Taiwan University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: Research purposes: 1. Construct the caring scale in service learning courses. 2. Verify the reliability and validity of caring scale in service learning curriculum.

detailed_description.textblock: Background: The core value of healthcare education is caring. However, caring traits are learned and acquired. Service learning advocates learning by doing. Through experience learning, students are guided to learn caring attitude or caring behaviour. Thus, teachers should construct appropriate assessments to understand caring traits as a transformative process from students' learning. Teachers should also adjust the pace of teaching continuously and design appropriate courses to facilitate students' achievement of their learning goals.

primary_outcome.measure: first impression scale of service facility
primary_outcome.description: Developing and validating the first impression scale in traditional Chinese language. The study uses the likert scale with five point scale: very positive, positive, neutral, negative, and very negative. The more positive feeling is more higher score.

primary_outcome.measure: service-learning experience of scale for caring
primary_outcome.description: Developing and validating the service-learning experience scale for caring in traditional Chinese language. A higher score indicates more caring experiences.

Developing and validating the team atmosphere questionnaire for service-learning in traditional Chinese language. The study uses the likert scale with five point scale: very positive, positive, neutral, negative, and very negative. The more positive feeling is more higher score.
Developing and validating a idea transformation questionnaire after service-learning in traditional Chinese language. A higher score indicates more idea changes.

Developing and validating the perceived behavioral control for caring in traditional Chinese language. The study uses the likert scale with five point scale: agree strongly, agree, neutral, disagree, and disagree strongly. The higher score indicates higher caring ability. The lower score indicates more difficult/limited to do caring behavior.

Developing and validating the behavioral intention of caring in traditional Chinese language. The study uses the likert scale with five point scale: agree strongly, agree, neutral, disagree, and disagree strongly. The higher score indicates higher commit for caring behavior in the near future.

secondary_outcome.description: Three items for personal attitude towards caring including cognition, affection and behavior. The score range from 0-15. The higher score means more positive attitude of caring.

Personal caring ability is mainly influenced by those important people. The study uses the likert scale with five point scale: very important, important, neutral, unimportant, and very unimportant. The more important feeling is more higher score.
Validating and reliability for selfishness scale in traditional Chinese language. The range score is from 0-48. A higher score indicates more selfishness.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- undergraduate students after attending a service learning course
Exclusion Criteria:
- undergraduate students who refuse or are unwilling to participate in service learning courses.
